intro: Labisia pothoina, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Indian balsam, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Labisia pothoina is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
